intro: Stephanopodium engleri, commonly known as the Malayan stephanopodium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small white to greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and poorly understood species.
